members.name: trackBuffer
members.comment: The distance that the track is from the side of the control

return: the shadow color
the highlight color
the focus color

members.name: isDragging
members.comment: Returns true if the user is dragging the slider.

return: true if the user is dragging the slider
a UI
a track listener
a change listener
a composite listener
a focus listener
a scroll listener
a property change listener

param: width - the width to get the baseline for
height - the height to get the baseline for
throws: IllegalArgumentException - if width or height is < 0
return: baseline or a value < 0 indicating there is no reasonable baseline

members.name: getBaselineResizeBehavior
members.comment: Returns an enum indicating how the baseline of the component changes as the size changes.

param: c - JComponent to return baseline resize behavior for
return: an enum indicating how the baseline changes as the component size changes

members.name: labelsHaveSameBaselines
members.comment: Returns true if all the labels from the label table have the same baseline.

return: true if all the labels from the label table have the same baseline
the preferred horizontal size
the preferred vertical size
the minimum horizontal size
the minimum vertical size
the preferred size
the minimum size
the maximum size

members.name: getTickLength
members.comment: Gets the height of the tick area for horizontal sliders and the width of the tick area for vertical sliders. BasicSliderUI uses the returned value to determine the tick area rectangle. If you want to give your ticks some room, make this larger than you need and paint your ticks away from the sides in paintTicks().

return: an integer representing the height of the tick area for horizontal sliders, and the width of the tick area for the vertical sliders
the thumb size

members.name: getWidthOfWidestLabel
members.comment: Returns the width of the widest label.

return: the width of the widest label

members.name: getHeightOfTallestLabel
members.comment: Returns the height of the tallest label.

return: the height of the tallest label

members.name: getWidthOfHighValueLabel
members.comment: Returns the width of the highest value label.

return: the width of the highest value label

members.name: getWidthOfLowValueLabel
members.comment: Returns the width of the lowest value label.

return: the width of the lowest value label

members.name: getHeightOfHighValueLabel
members.comment: Returns the height of the highest value label.

return: the height of the highest value label

members.name: getHeightOfLowValueLabel
members.comment: Returns the height of the lowest value label.

return: the height of the lowest value label
the inverted-ness

members.name: getHighestValue
members.comment: Returns the biggest value that has an entry in the label table.

return: biggest value that has an entry in the label table, or null.

members.name: getLowestValue
members.comment: Returns the smallest value that has an entry in the label table.

return: smallest value that has an entry in the label table, or null.

members.name: getLowestValueLabel
members.comment: Returns the label that corresponds to the highest slider value in the label table.

return: the label that corresponds to the highest slider value in the label table

members.name: getHighestValueLabel
members.comment: Returns the label that corresponds to the lowest slider value in the label table.

return: the label that corresponds to the lowest slider value in the label table

members.name: recalculateIfInsetsChanged
members.comment: Recalculates if the insets have changed.

members.name: recalculateIfOrientationChanged
members.comment: Recalculates if the orientation has changed.

members.name: paintMinorTickForHorizSlider
members.comment: Paints minor tick for horizontal slider.

members.name: paintMajorTickForHorizSlider
members.comment: Paints major tick for horizontal slider.

members.name: paintMinorTickForVertSlider
members.comment: Paints minor tick for vertical slider.

members.name: paintMajorTickForVertSlider
members.comment: Paints major tick for vertical slider.

members.name: paintHorizontalLabel
members.comment: Called for every label in the label table. Used to draw the labels for horizontal sliders. The graphics have been translated to labelRect.y already.

param: g - the graphics context in which to paint
label - the component label in the label table that needs to be painted

members.name: paintVerticalLabel
members.comment: Called for every label in the label table. Used to draw the labels for vertical sliders. The graphics have been translated to labelRect.x already.

param: g - the graphics context in which to paint
label - the component label in the label table that needs to be painted

members.name: scrollDueToClickInTrack
members.comment: This function is called when a mousePressed was detected in the track, not in the thumb. The default behavior is to scroll by block. You can override this method to stop it from scrolling or to add additional behavior.

param: dir - the direction and number of blocks to scroll

members.name: xPositionForValue
members.comment: Returns the x position for a value.

return: the x position for a value

members.name: yPositionForValue
members.comment: Returns the y position for a value.

return: the y position for a value

members.name: yPositionForValue
members.comment: Returns the y location for the specified value. No checking is done on the arguments. In particular if trackHeight is negative undefined results may occur.

param: value - the slider value to get the location for
return: the y location for the specified value of the slider

members.name: valueForYPosition
members.comment: Returns the value at the y position. If yPos is beyond the track at the bottom or the top, this method sets the value to either the minimum or maximum value of the slider, depending on if the slider is inverted or not.

param: yPos - the location of the slider along the y axis
return: the value at the y position

members.name: valueForXPosition
members.comment: Returns the value at the x position. If xPos is beyond the track at the left or the right, this method sets the value to either the minimum or maximum value of the slider, depending on if the slider is inverted or not.

param: xPos - the location of the slider along the x axis
return: the value of the x position

name: javax.swing.plaf.basic.BasicSliderUI
comment: A Basic L&F implementation of SliderUI.
